Common measures uncertainty include standard error, standard deviation, confidence interval, coefficient variation statistical significance (149).Understandable/Simplicity indicator presented clear, concise easily comprehensible way. indicator must understood responsible taking action , specifically, responsible decision-making (23,60).

title: Unit of measure
text: Unit measure indicator presented (e.g. deaths per 1000 live births; US$; litres per person per year). Note: Percentage considered unit measure indicators presented percentages unit measure field filled ‘n/’

title: Usefulness or Utility
text: indicator useful programme improvement policy issues (60).

title: Validity
text: Ability indicator measure intended measure (.e. absence distortions, bias systematic errors). relevant biases related selection study population quality information compiled (23).

title: Verbal autopsy
text: interview carried family members caregivers deceased using structured questionnaire elicit signs symptoms pertinent information can later used assign probable underlying cause death (150).

title: Vital event
text: Events captured civil registration vital statistic systems, usually include live birth, death, fetal death, marriage, divorce, annulment marriage, judicial separation marriage, adoption, legitimation, recognition parenthood, change name nationality (151).

title: Vital statistics
text: systematic record vital events birth, marriage, divorce, adoption, death, cause death generate data statistics (152).

title: Weighting
text: technique used adjust data reflect known population profile. used balance significant variance actual target profile. Weighted analyses population-based surveys allow us generalize findings larger general population. approach aims provide unbiased estimates descriptive statistics model parameters population interest, may general population major population subgroup. Incorporating weights analyses can crucial achieve statistically valid, representative population-based findings surveys make adjustments sampling errors (153).Y

text: Represents equivalent one full year healthy life lost due disability ill- health. prevalence years lived disability calculated prevalence non-fatal condition multiplied disability weight (155).Z22 Glossary terms related thematic areas Users glossary may wish know terms align different data concepts thematic areas. glossary terms grouped according thematic areas. terms may appear one thematic area.

title: Years of life lost
text: Represents loss one year life. Years life lost calculated number deaths multiplied global standard life expectancy age death occurs (154).

text: Dubey Y (2025). “glossarywho: Glossary.” doi:10.5281/zenodo.14754017, https://github.com/openwashdata/glossarywho.
code: @Misc{dubey:2025,   title = {glossarywho: WHO Glossary},   author = {Yash Dubey},   year = {2025},   doi = {10.5281/zenodo.14754017},   url = {https://github.com/openwashdata/glossarywho},   abstract = {This package provides access to a tidy version of the WHO Glossary (https://www.who.int/publications/i/item/9789240105485) and thematic areas for each term.},   version = {0.1.0}, }

title: WHO Glossary
text: goal glossarywho provide data Glossary tidy format.

title: WHO Glossary
text: can install development version glossarywho GitHub : Alternatively, can download individual datasets CSV XLSX file table . Click Download CSV. window opens displays CSV browser. Right-click anywhere inside window select “Save Page …”. Save file folder choice.
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("openwashdata/glossarywho") ## Run the following code in console if you don't have the packages ## install.packages(c("dplyr", "knitr", "readr", "stringr", "gt", "kableExtra")) library(dplyr) library(knitr) library(readr) library(stringr) library(gt) library(kableExtra)

title: WHO Glossary
text: package provides access glossary terms, definitions thematic areas Glossary. datasets : themes definitions.

title: WHO Glossary
text: dataset definitions contains data definitions glossary 207 observations 2 variables

title: WHO Glossary
text: dataset themes contains data thematic areas glossary. 217 observations 2 variables overview variable names, see following table.

title: WHO Glossary
code: library(glossarywho) library(ggplot2) library(tidyverse) # Plot a bar chart of count of definitions by thematic areas  themes |>    count(`Thematic Area`) |>    ggplot2::ggplot(aes(x = fct_reorder(`Thematic Area`, n), y = n)) +   geom_col(fill = "skyblue") +   coord_flip() +   labs(title = "Count of definitions by thematic areas",        x = "Count",        y = "Thematic area") +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.y = element_text(size = 8)) +   theme(panel.grid.major.y = element_blank(),          panel.grid.minor.y = element_blank()) # Wordcloud of most common words from definitions library(wordcloud) library(tm)  # Create a corpus corpus <- Corpus(VectorSource(definitions$Description))  # Clean the corpus corpus <- tm_map(corpus, content_transformer(tolower)) corpus <- tm_map(corpus, removePunctuation) corpus <- tm_map(corpus, removeNumbers) corpus <- tm_map(corpus, removeWords, stopwords("en")) corpus <- tm_map(corpus, stripWhitespace)  # Create a document term matrix dtm <- DocumentTermMatrix(corpus)  # Create a wordcloud wordcloud(words = names(sort(colSums(as.matrix(dtm)), decreasing = TRUE)),           freq = colSums(as.matrix(dtm)),           min.freq = 1,           max.words = 100,           random.order = FALSE,           colors = brewer.pal(8, "Dark2"))

title: WHO Glossary

"glossarywho: WHO Glossary." #>   doi:10.5281/zenodo.14754017 #>   <https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.14754017>, #>   <https://github.com/openwashdata/glossarywho>. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Misc{dubey:2025, #>     title = {glossarywho: WHO Glossary}, #>     author = {Yash Dubey}, #>     year = {2025}, #>     doi = {10.5281/zenodo.14754017}, #>     url = {https://github.com/openwashdata/glossarywho}, #>     abstract = {This package provides access to a tidy version of the WHO Glossary (https://www.who.int/publications/i/item/9789240105485) and thematic areas for each term.}, #>     version = {0.1.0}, #>   }
